before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"797gu","text":"This protocol has three sections:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bvt1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i5nr","text":"Section 1:  NCBI-SRA Run Selector","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evojl","text":"Section 2:  NCBI-BioSample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7icm5","text":"Section 3:  NCBI-SRA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg45d","text":"Section 4:  NCBI-Pathogen Detection","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnvkm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebihg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auubd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7plnc","text":"PURPOSE: This document provides detailed instructions on how to find bacterial pathogen genomic data and associated contextual information at NCBI, specifically at the BioSample, SRA, and Pathogen Detection databases. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f62hq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70ja5","text":"SCOPE: This protocol is intended for use by any laboratory submitting WGS data of bacterial pathogens to NCBI for analysis within NCBI Pathogen Detection. This includes US labs connected to GenomeTrakr, NARMS, Vet-LIRN, NAHLN, and other international networks and submitters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bibm0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfp34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"pdu0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bar4m","text":"NCBI-Pathogen Detection Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/docs/HowTo/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":50}],"data":{}},{"key":"98o2r","text":"NCBI-Pathogen Detection Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/pathogens_help/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":39,"length":54}],"data":{}},{"key":"b5ubq","text":"SRA Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra/docs/submitupdate/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":19,"length":51}],"data":{}},{"key":"68vbn","text":"BioSample Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/docs/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":25,"length":44}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8F44EDA8B56811EEA3AC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/docs/HowTo"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"96E24FA1B56811EEA3AC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/pathogens_help"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A16F482CBBBE11EE9E0E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra/docs/submitupdate"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CD4595A4BBBE11EE9E0E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/docs"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4662n","text":"WGS submissions of pathogen genomes will become public and searchable almost immediately in SRA Run Selector. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":92,"length":16}],"data":{}},{"key":"613ui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ooj7","text":"NCBI's SRA Run Selector serves as a platform for querying contextual data, or metadta, from both BioSample and SRA. This is a good first place to check for a recent submission, obtaining a single table containing a suite of NCBI accessions and metadata for both samples and sequence data. For our application, users could enter a single or comma-separated list of IDs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":92,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cadho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehn2l","text":"Example query with SRA run accessions: SRR24927895,SRR24927896,SRR24937652,SRR24937653","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn0nr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv2f8","text":"Additionally, a BioProject accession (or multiple BioProject accessions) can be entered to retrieve a complete table of submissions linked to that BioProject(s). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46ude","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5050","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8746l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j5ft","text":"Download table: Click on the -Metadata- button to download the tab-delimited file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FA6E2ADBBBC11EE9E0E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Traces/study/?go=home"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":274.1818181818182,"id":447515,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"61gl8\",\"text\":\"Isolate and experimental metadata displayed in tabular format. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Screen Shot 2024-01-29 at 2.50.54 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa79zje.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa59zje.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa69zje.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa49zje.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9dsk","text":"Submissions should be available in SRA within 1-3 days. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40aa6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edf02","text":"Strain identifiers and/or NCBI accessions can be used as queries.  Multiple isolate identifiers can be included in the search box by using the \" OR \" separator.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bgre","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f45if","text":"Example with SRA run accessions: SRR24927896 OR SRR24927895 OR SRR24937653 OR SRR24937652.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"estdo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nlb0","text":"Users can click on the SRA records themselves, or they can send the results to SRA run selector for a tabular output. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55n2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc51h","text":"Click -Send results to Run selector-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80aq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b65c2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"da2uu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":416,"id":447519,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"SRA OR.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxbb9zje.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa99zje.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxba9zje.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxa89zje.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dka6d","text":"NCBI Pathogen Detection performs cluster analysis and genotyping screening for antimicrobial resistance, stress response and virulence genes. Visit NCBI-Pathogen Detection HowTo for extensive documentation on how to access analysis results.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":23},{"key":1,"offset":172,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"47npf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56ijf","text":"Analysis results expected in \u003c1 day for all organisms except Salmonella, which requires about two days for cluster results. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":61,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpvug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc2c6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9lgso","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"civ9d","text":"Strain identifiers and/or NCBI accessions can be used to query NCBI Pathogen Detection. Delimiters are not needed for querying this database. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":103,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es69l","text":"Example query with BioSample accessions: SAMN33598462 SAMN36638873 SAMN06712285.  Direct cut/paste from an excel table also works here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m5je","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jecs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"76m4s","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch6qq","text":"For each query, users will see results summarized within two tables:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bmjf","text":"Table 1.
